context: Before the first race — at a car meet in Downtown Nova Pacifica

lines.text: The parking lot behind the strip mall is alive. Bass thumps from someone's system. Engines idle and rev. The air smells like tire rubber and cheap cologne.
You pull in slow, keeping your head down. Nobody knows you here. Nobody cares about your rusted sedan or your empty wallet. Not yet.
Yo, fresh face! You here to race or you here to watch?
A wiry guy with a backwards cap and a confident grin leans against a modified hatchback. Two hundred horses at least, judging by the sound.

choices.text: Race. Point me to the start line.
I just got here. What's the scene like?

lines.label: race_accepted
lines.speaker: Street Racer
lines.text: Ha! I like that. Straight to the point. $300 buy-in, winner takes all. Two miles down Harbor Road to the overpass. You in?
Three hundred dollars. More than half your cash. But you didn't come to Nova Pacifica to play it safe.

lines.label: discuss_stakes
lines.speaker: Street Racer
lines.text: $300 buy-in. Winner takes the pot. Simple as it gets around here.

lines.speaker: Street Racer
lines.text: Don't worry about your ride. We'll handicap it fair — it's a gentleman's race. Mostly.

lines.label: learn_scene
lines.speaker: Street Racer
lines.text: Scene? It's simple. You race, you win, you earn. You lose, you pay. Nobody cares where you came from — only how fast you go.

lines.speaker: Street Racer
lines.text: Tonight's light. Just a few sprint races. $300 buy-in if you want a piece. What do you say?

lines.label: pre_race_final
lines.text: The crowd starts drifting toward Harbor Road. Headlights flick on one by one. The race is happening with or without you.
You roll to the line. Your engine sounds pathetic next to his. But engines can lie. Let's see what this thing can do.
